articles.author: Joanna Kakissis
articles.title: Portuguese kids are suing European countries because of climate change - NPR
articles.description: Adults "can see us as serious or they can see us as a joke," one of the kids says. "A lawsuit is not a joke," her brother adds. The European Court of Human Rights has fast-tracked their 2020 lawsuit.
articles.content: Sixteen-year-old Sofia (left) and 13-year-old André Oliveira stand in Parque da Paz in Lisbon. The siblings are two of six young people in Portugal who are suing the governments of Europe's most poll… [+9198 chars]

articles.title: Nigeria backs SA in criticism of travel bans over Omicron COVID variant - Eyewitness News
articles.description: Several countries including the UK, US and Rwanda have moved to ban southern Africans from travelling to their shores after scientists in South Africa identified the new variant which has since been found in several European countries as well.

articles.title: European Karate champion jailed for six years for sexual assault on college student - thejournal.ie
articles.description: Rachel McElroy told the court she cried for hours after the attack as videos of which bystanders posted on social media.
articles.content:
A EUROPEAN KARATE champion who sexually assaulted a young college student outside a nightclub and then lifted her up the road to further attack her has been jailed for six years.
